articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party and Minister of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, on the occasion of his birthday (February 16).
 It was conveyed to the DPRK Ambassador in Havana by an official in charge of external affairs of the Ministry of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba on Feb. 14.

articles.title: Korean people's cause supported by Vietnamese President
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from president of IADL 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Jitendra Sharma, president of the International Association of Democratic Lawyers (IADL), on the occasion of his birthday (Feb. 16).
 The gift was conveyed to the DPRK Ambassador to India by the President on Feb. 15. 
 When conveying it, he said that Kim Jong Il's birthday is a significant holiday not only for the Korean people but for the  world peace-loving people and so it is a great pleasure and honor for him to present his humble gift to Kim Jong Il who has greatly contributed to Korea's reunification.    
 Although a tense situation is now prevailing on the Korean Peninsula owing to the U.S. imperialists' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK, the Korean people will certainly reunify the  country by implementing the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, he added.

articles.content:
Korean people's cause supported by Vietnamese President 
    Pyongyang, February 21 (KCNA) -- The party, the government and the people of Vietnam will positively support the Korean people's just efforts for socialist construction and national reunification and hope that the traditional friendly relations between the two countries will steadily grow stronger and develop.
 Vietnamese President Tran Duc Luong said this when receiving credentials from new DPRK Ambassador to Vietnam Pak Ung Sop on Feb. 17.
